While going through Messari‚Äôs State of TRON Q4 2025 report, one data point caught my attention.   Messari mentions that Uquid, a multichain Web3 shopping platform, recorded its largest transaction volume on TRON during 2025.   This is interesting because most discussions around TRON usually focus on stablecoin transfers or DeFi-related activity. Seeing a commerce-focused platform showing meaningful volume suggests that a portion of TRON‚Äôs usage is tied to actual consumer payments, not just financial primitives.   If this trend continues, it could indicate that TRON‚Äôs infrastructure is increasingly being used for real-world payment use cases, especially in regions where crypto payments are already practical.   Curious to see whether other commerce or payment platforms on TRON show similar patterns going forward. $HYPE

HYPERLIQUID SURGES 40% PUSHES PAST $30  $HYPE  jumped over 40%, clearing $30 as anticipation builds around a Kraken listing while rising Bitcoin perpetual liquidity and heavy trading of Gold and Silver in HIP-3 markets fuel bullish momentum.  Ôªø#HYPE

Hyperliquid ($HYPE ) showed a strong price breakout during the last 24 hours. The price moved quickly from the$22 - $24 range and reached around $34. On the four hour chart, the price clearly broke above $30 - $34 resistance area with high trading volume.  Reasons behind the move: ‚Ä¢ A surge in commodity trading activity supported the rally. The silver ( $XAG  ) perpetual market recorded more than $1B in daily volume. Higher trading volume increases platform fees, which are used to buy back and burn HYPE tokens.  ‚Ä¢ Open interest on HIP three markets reached a new record near $790M.  ‚Ä¢ A large short squeeze happened. More than $25M worth of short positions were liquidated, forcing buyers into the market.  Technical outlook The breakout confirms strong bullish momentum. However, the price is currently extended, and a short period of consolidation or a mild pullback is possible.

$HYPE chart looks strong ,momentum remains intact with no signs of heavy selling pressure.

The double-bottom pattern projected upside targets at 32 and then 39.75, both aligning well with the current structure.

It‚Äôll be interesting to see how this plays out, especially whether price tests the daily EMA200 around 35.5 or manages to extend toward the 39.75 level first.

üîç Liquidity Wars vs User Trust: A Changing Dynamic Among DEXs  For years, decentralized exchanges fought primarily through liquidity incentives. High APYs attracted capital quickly, but just as quickly, that capital rotated elsewhere. This model produced volume, but not necessarily loyalty.  STONfi approaches the DEX battle from a different angle on TON. Instead of relying solely on aggressive incentives, it benefits from being deeply embedded in an ecosystem optimized for frequent, low-friction interaction. As users prioritize reliability and familiarity, trust becomes a stronger retention mechanism than yield alone.  In this phase of DeFi, DEXs are no longer judged only by how much liquidity they attract, but by how consistently users return.  This post is for educational and informational purposes only. No financial advice. Always conduct your own research.  #DEXwars  #DeFi  #TON  #STONfi  #DYOR  $HYPE

HYPE Rallies +25% as Commodity Perps Drive $1B+ Volume Shock  $HYPE  extended its rally for a 3rd consecutive session, gaining 25%+ intraday, as capital rotated into the protocol following an unexpected surge in commodity perpetuals, led by Silver futures. While broader crypto flows remain selective, Hyperliquid is attracting a non-crypto-native trader base, reshaping short-term demand for HYPE.  Following the HIP-3 expansion, Silver perpetuals rapidly became one of Hyperliquid‚Äôs most traded instruments, pushing commodity notional volume beyond $1B/day. This matters structurally: commodity traders are typically less sensitive to crypto volatility and more focused on macro exposure. Their activity feeds directly into Hyperliquid‚Äôs fee engine, strengthening HYPE‚Äôs value accrual loop. Importantly, elevated volumes have persisted across multiple sessions, signaling organic demand rather than incentive-driven spikes.  As of Jan 28, 2026, total HIP-3 Open Interest reached $920.9M, one of the strongest sustained expansions since launch. Positioning is concentrated, with a single contract contributing $803.3M, indicating large directional exposure rather than fragmented retail flow. Additional markets (HYNA $64.9M, FLX $22.0M) confirm broader suite participation. Rising OI alongside high volume reduces leverage-only risk and aligns with institutional-style positioning.  HYPE has broken its descending channel and is up 40%+ from recent lows. Short-term MAs are turning upward, signaling trend reversal. A clean break above the 200-day EMA at $38 keeps $50 in focus. On pullbacks, $30‚Äì28 remains the key higher-low zone; a loss of $25 would invalidate the near-term bullish structure.  #BTC Price Analysis#  #Bitcoin Price Prediction: What is Bitcoins next move?#

üöÄ $HYPE  Is Heating Up: DeFi Perps Just Hit a New Gear üî•  Hey fam, big picture on $HYPE  right now üëá  Big move in DeFi this week - open interest across Hyperliquid‚Äôs HIP-3-powered DEXs just hit a massive new high, surging to around $790M+, roughly 3√ó last month‚Äôs $260M and up 60%+ over the past week üìà   What‚Äôs fueling this? The US Senate will vote on the Crypto Market Structure Bill on January 29th.
The Crypto Market Structure Bill is a proposed U.S. legislative framework aimed at bringing clear, modern rules to how digital assets are regulated and traded. Instead of outdated or fragmented guidelines, this bill seeks to establish consistent legal definitions and supervision for the crypto markets something the industry has been waiting years for.
